source_document.title: NIST Special Publication 1500-100: Logic Standards for Deterministic Governance Systems

target_rubric.title: UD-00 Benson Execution Agent Assessment Rubric

requirement_mappings.nist_text: All logic gates (AND, OR, XOR, NOT) MUST produce identical outputs for identical inputs across all execution contexts
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - rubric criterion explicitly tests gate output consistency

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Logic gate evaluation order MUST be explicitly defined and immutable
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Covered under gate integrity verification through iteration testing

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Compound logic expressions MUST be decomposable into atomic gate operations
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Gate verification inherently tests atomic decomposition

requirement_mappings.nist_text: State machines MUST define all valid state transitions explicitly
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - rubric tests state coverage analysis

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Undefined state transitions MUST result in FAIL_CLOSED behavior
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Implicit in 100% coverage requirement - undefined states fail

requirement_mappings.nist_text: State transition audit trails MUST be cryptographically anchored
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Cross-referenced to AUDIT_INTEGRITY category for hash verification

requirement_mappings.nist_text: All decision logic MUST be reproducible given identical inputs and context
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - replay test verifies reproducibility

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Random or probabilistic elements MUST be seeded deterministically
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Covered under reproducibility - deterministic seeding enables replay

requirement_mappings.nist_text: All inputs MUST be validated against explicit schema definitions
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - schema validation test suite

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Invalid inputs MUST be rejected with deterministic error codes
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - error code consistency test

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Input validation logic MUST NOT modify input data
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Implicit in schema validation - validation is read-only

requirement_mappings.nist_text: All outputs MUST conform to declared output schemas
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - output schema verification

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Output verification failures MUST trigger audit events
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Cross-referenced to AUDIT_INTEGRITY - failures create audit records

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Mapping completeness MUST be verifiable to 100% coverage
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - coverage analysis requirement

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Partial mappings MUST be rejected; no incomplete states allowed
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Implicit in 100% completeness requirement

requirement_mappings.nist_text: All audit records MUST be append-only and tamper-evident
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - integrity verification test

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Audit records MUST include cryptographic hashes for integrity verification
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - hash verification suite

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Audit deletion or modification attempts MUST trigger SCRAM conditions
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - SCRAM activation test

requirement_mappings.nist_text: All artifacts MUST trace to originating authority (PAC, agent, or system)
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Direct 1:1 mapping - chain traversal verification

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Provenance chains MUST be unbroken from creation to current state
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Covered under chain integrity - 100% traceable requirement

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Hash chains MUST use SHA-256 or stronger cryptographic algorithms
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Implicit in hash verification - algorithm strength validated

requirement_mappings.nist_text: Hash chain breaks MUST be detected and reported within one processing cycle
requirement_mappings.alignment_rationale: Cross-referenced to SCRAM - chain breaks trigger immediate response

L2_completeness.condition: Validate mapping completeness for all rubric criteria
